text: Influenza H5N1 infection in birds is systemic, characterized by hemorrhage and pulmonary edema resulting from virus replication and stimulation of vascular endothelial growth factor in the alveolar endothelium [57, 58] . Systemic infection has also been observed in cynomolgus macaques and humans [59, 60] . In mice infected with influenza H5N1/ 97, virus-infected cells initially appeared in the respiratory tract and later could be detected in neurons, glial and ependymal cells of the central nervous system [61] .
